content:
San Francisco's Muni system is a great way to get around the city.

According to the San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency (SFMTA) website, the cost of a monthly Muni pass varies depending on your age and income level. Here are the current prices:

* Adult (18-64): $96 per month
* Youth (13-17): $76 per month
* Senior (65+): $36 per month
* Disabled: $36 per month
* Low-Income: $76 per month (requires eligibility and application)

You can purchase a monthly Muni pass at various locations, including:

1. Muni Metro stations: You can buy a pass at any Muni Metro station ticket vending machine or at the ticket booth.
2. Clipper Card retailers: Many retail locations in San Francisco, including grocery stores, pharmacies, and coffee shops, sell Clipper Cards, which can be loaded with a Muni monthly pass. You can find a list of retailers on the Clipper Card website.
3. SFMTA Customer Service Center: You can visit the SFMTA Customer Service Center at 275 South Van Ness Avenue, San Francisco, CA 94103.
4. Online: You can also purchase a monthly pass online through the Clipper Card website or the MuniMobile app.

Regarding your experience with Uber, $20 is indeed a steep price for a single ride. A monthly Muni pass can be a cost-effective option, especially if you take the bus regularly. It's worth considering, especially if you don't have access to your car frequently.

If you have any more questions or need help with purchasing a monthly pass, feel free to ask!
